ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Leave the person I created on his own to Me alone,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Leave him to Me whom I created alone,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Leave Me with him whom I alone have created,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Leave to Me the one, whom I have created all by Myself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Leave him to Me, the one whom I created single.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Leave Me alone (to deal) with whom I created lonely.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Leave Me and him whom I created alone,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Leave Me with him whom I created alone,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Leave Me (to deal) with him whom I created lonely,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Leave Me alone [to deal] with him whom I have created alone,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Let Me alone with him whom I created lonely.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Leave Me [to deal] with him whom I created alone,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Leave Me alone, (to deal) with the (creature) whom I created (bare and) alone!-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Leave Me Alone (to deal) with whom I created Alone (without any means, i.e. Al-Walid bin Al-Mughirah Al-Makhzumi)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Leave Me alone with he whom I created
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Leave Me to him whom I created alone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Leave Me with the one I created alone
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:11] Leave Me [to deal] with him whom I created (wa-man khalaqtu is a supplement to the direct object, or [it is] an object of accompaniment) lonely (wahīdan is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the man, ‘whom’, or to the pronoun referring to it but omitted from khalaqtu [sc. khalaqtuhu]), alone, without family or wealth — this was al-Walīd b. al-Mughīra al-Makhzūmī —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Leave Me) Muhammad ((to deal) with him whom I created lonely) without wealth, children or spouse, this is a threat from Allah to al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah al-Makhzumi.
